newsitem.title: USA: WavePhore working with Microsoft on PC/TV.
newsitem.headline: WavePhore working with Microsoft on PC/TV.

text.p: Wireless data broadcasting firm WavePhore Inc Thursday said it will team with Microsoft Corp on new technologies for the emerging PC/TV market.
Terms of the agreement were not disclosed.

WavePhore said Microsoft's plans include developing an environment in whire WavePhore's would automatically broadcast filtered multimedia content to homes via PC/TVs without the need for Internet connections or modems.

WavePhore said it will transmit data over the existing broadcast television signals of the 250 Public Broadcasting System member stations, reaching more than 99 percent of television households in the U.S., and in Canada through its partnership with the Canadian Broadcasting Corporation.

WavePhore relies on a technology called Vertical Blanking Interval (VBI). It allows the firm to transmit data to personal computers in a way that relieves the congestion constraining conventional information delivery via the telephone.

"WavePhore is committed to using its consumer data broadcasting network to create a new channel for content providers to deliver TV, PC and Internet data at high speeds directly to consumers' desk-tops using the Microsoft Windows platform," said David Deeds, president of WavePhore.
WavePhore shares stood at 9-3/4 Thursday, down 5/8. The stock has risen from 6-3/4 at the start of the new year.
